    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2016-election/four-things-we-learned-trump-s-visit-hill-n573116</guid>
      <title>Four Things We Learned From Trump's Visit to the Hill</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:36:49 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2016-election/four-things-we-learned-trump-s-visit-hill-n573116</link>
      <dc:creator>Perry Bacon Jr.  </dc:creator>
      <description>It didn't result in a complete healing in the rift between the presumptive nominee and some GOP leaders. Yet both sides hailed the trip as productive.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535556/ap_16133463986612_47d69c0d0476700bfe9800aa07eed2aa.jpg" medium="image" height="2036" width="3049">
        <media:credit>AP</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Donald Trump</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump waves as he arrives for a meeting with House Speaker Paul Ryan of Wis., at the Republican National Committee Headquarters on Capitol Hill in Washington, Thursday, May 12, 2016. Trump and Ryan are sitting down face-to-face for the first time, a week after Ryan stunned Republicans by refusing to back the mercurial billionaire for president.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535536/160512-paul-ryan-2206_d7d6eee259e82738e4933a1f5500b2fb.jpg" medium="image" height="1473" width="2210">
        <media:credit>Cliff Owen</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image:</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">House Speaker Paul Ryan of Wis. meets with reporters on Capitol Hill in Washington, Thursday, May 12, 2016, following his meeting with Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/missing-tennessee-girl-carlie-trent-found-uncle-nabbed-n573216</guid>
      <title>Missing Tennessee Girl Carlie Trent Found, Uncle Nabbed</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:52:32 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/missing-tennessee-girl-carlie-trent-found-uncle-nabbed-n573216</link>
      <dc:creator>Corky Siemaszko and Daniella Silva</dc:creator>
      <description>Carlie Trent, the 9-year-old Tennessee girl who was allegedly kidnapped by her uncle last week, has been found, police said Thursday.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535436/160512-carlie-trent-mn-1915_05d3ae916e6c8c0856157570041a09e8.jpg" medium="image" height="688" width="766">
        <media:credit>Tennessee Bureau of Investigation via AP</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Carlie Marie Trentd</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Carlie Marie Trentd is seen in an undated photo provided by  the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535261/160512-carlie-trent-mn-1730_e3e1f3d3b026745f7823f1d9dbbfd7d6.jpg" medium="image" height="922" width="747">
        <media:credit></media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain"></media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535441/160512-gary-simpson-mn-1915_24d4c9ead3295dc0758be42a33327ea9.JPG" medium="image" height="2500" width="1875">
        <media:credit>Tennessee Bureau of Investigation via AP</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image:</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Gary Simpson</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/three-navy-seal-trainees-last-four-classes-died-n573146</guid>
      <title>Three Deaths Raise Questions About Navy SEAL Training Program</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:45:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/three-navy-seal-trainees-last-four-classes-died-n573146</link>
      <dc:creator>Ken Dilanian and Mike Hixenbaugh</dc:creator>
      <description>Derek Lovelace died during BUD/S training, and Daniel DelBianco and Caplen Weare died soon after.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535191/160512-delbianco-weare-lovelace-mn-1640_fad30b4f44a9e01973e9d3aaf2b8d545.jpg" medium="image" height="1400" width="1600">
        <media:credit>U.S. Navy; Courtesy of families</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">From left, Derek Lovelace, Caplen Weare and Daniel DelBianco.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535176/160512-daniel-delbianco-mn-1620_321fa926006a712fa2df0d9e2cc72196.jpg" medium="image" height="2500" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Courtesy of DelBianco family</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Daniel DelBianco played rugby for USC.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1531816/160510-lovelace-jsw-4p_163127a202ff03fdbed95352c389ae8b.jpg" medium="image" height="3385" width="2500">
        <media:credit>U.S. Navy</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Seaman James Derek Lovelace, 21, died during basic underwater demolition/SEAL training, better known as BUD/S.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535021/160512-caplen-weare-mdl_41d25f1071c9d366522072ede6ead4a4.jpg" medium="image" height="533" width="800">
        <media:credit>In Loving Memory of Caplen Weare</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Caplen Weare died in a traffic accident soon after leaving SEAL training.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/phoenix-airport-screening-operational-after-glitch-leaves-3-000-bags-n573411</guid>
      <title>TSA Tech Glitch Leaves 3,000 Bags Left Behind in Phoenix</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:04:09 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/phoenix-airport-screening-operational-after-glitch-leaves-3-000-bags-n573411</link>
      <dc:creator>Phil Helsel</dc:creator>
      <description>More than 3,000 pieces of luggage were left behind as their passengers departed after a server problem stopped an automated screening system.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535671/ap_865346084508_1_30b51d8ccaf8e5fe4c36aaed1d588c7f.jpg" medium="image" height="2360" width="3600">
        <media:credit>AP</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Sky Harbor International Airport</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Baggage sits in the special events parking lot, Thursday, May 12, 2016, at Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport. More than 3,000 checked bags missed their outbound flights in Phoenix  because of a problem with a screening system at Sky Harbor International Airport, officials with Transportation Security Administration said.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/photo/kim-jong-un-portraits-n573026</guid>
      <title>Unusual Portraits Show Kim Jong Un, Other Leaders Up Close</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:14:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/news/photo/kim-jong-un-portraits-n573026</link>
      <dc:creator>The Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>North Korea released portraits of Kim Jong Un and other officials that are remarkable for not showing any signs of retouching.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1534611/160512-kim-jong-un-mn-1120_5389173fd689ee3897b1d11eb0fdd360.JPG" medium="image" height="4040" width="3312">
        <media:credit>Korean News Service via AP</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image:</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Kim Jong Un poses for a portrait at the Workers' Party congress on May 9.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1534616/160512-north-korea-officials-mn-1130_76c6d63bb2445818d32aa34a8b9f24bf.JPG" medium="image" height="3500" width="2783">
        <media:credit>Korean Central News Agency via Reuters</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Ri Myong Su, a member of the Political Bureau of the C. C., the WPK, is pictured in this KCNA handout photo</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Ri Myong Su, a member of the Political Bureau of the C. C., the Workers' Party of Korea.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1534621/160502-north-korea-officials-mn-1131_76c6d63bb2445818d32aa34a8b9f24bf.JPG" medium="image" height="3500" width="2773">
        <media:credit>Korean Central News Agency via Reuters</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pak Yong Sik, a member of the Political Bureau of the C. C., the WPK, is pictured in this KCNA handout photo</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Pak Yong Sik, a member of the Political Bureau of the C. C., the Workers' Party of Korea.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1534626/160512-north-korea-officials-mn-1132_76c6d63bb2445818d32aa34a8b9f24bf.JPG" medium="image" height="4957" width="4000">
        <media:credit>Korea News Service via AP</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image:</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">In this combination of photos distributed on Wednesday, May 11, 2016, by the North Korean government, elected members and candidates of the Politburo of the North Korean Workers' Party pose for a photo at the Workers' Party congress.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/obama-admin-give-guidance-schools-transgender-bathroom-use-n573366</guid>
      <title>Feds to Give Guidance to Schools on Transgender Students and Bathrooms</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:41:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/obama-admin-give-guidance-schools-transgender-bathroom-use-n573366</link>
      <dc:creator>Kristin Donnelly and Hasani Gittens and The Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>The guidance to schools will be they should allow transgender students to use bathrooms and locker rooms consistent with their gender identity.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1529571/2016-05-04t003641z_564983324_s1betbzynpab_rtrmadp_3_north-carolina-lgbt_6afdf1bf9a81343a0fd8e279aa02caeb.jpg" medium="image" height="2397" width="3500">
        <media:credit>JONATHAN DRAKE</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: A bathroom sign welcomes both genders at the Cacao Cinnamon coffee shop in Durham, North Carolina</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">A bathroom sign welcomes both genders at the Cacao Cinnamon coffee shop in Durham, North Carolina May 3, 2016. </media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/congress-rips-tsa-smurfing-bonus-practices-n572986</guid>
      <title>Congress Rips TSA for Long Lines, Abuse, and Bonuses</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:03:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/congress-rips-tsa-smurfing-bonus-practices-n572986</link>
      <dc:creator>Corky Siemaszko</dc:creator>
      <description>TSA was criticized Thursday for giving an official a $90,000 bonus in chunks, a practice called "smurfing", long lines and abusive work practices.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1534796/160512-tsa-lines-mn-1300_d79e7c52430661af49a377607a4e9135.jpg" medium="image" height="1532" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Ted S. Warren</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image:</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Travelers move through a line for security screening at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport in Seattle on March 17, 2016.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1534766/160512-hoggan-kelly-mn-1230_1f389c54b497d872f64b210657c84a1a.jpg" medium="image" height="816" width="600">
        <media:credit>Transportation Security Administration</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Kelly Hoggan was named the Assistant Administrator for the Office of Security Operations in May 2013</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2015_31/1148021/150730-peter-neffenger-file-jsw-1016a_27d0bb163bbf18477755e6e950d64f34.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Jacquelyn Martin</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Peter Neffenger</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Coast Guard Vice Commandant Peter Neffenger testifies on Capitol Hill in Washington, Wednesday, June 10, 2015.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1055021/140423-tsa-jms-1611_0_250cd77d96c847e267e7fb32f1ec13ed.jpg" medium="image" height="1540" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Mario Anzuoni</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: A TSA officer inspects items from a piece of luggage at Los Angeles International Airport in Los Angeles</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">A Transportation Security Administration (TSA) officer inspects items from a piece of luggage at Los Angeles International Airport in 2013.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/four-americans-sentenced-failed-gambian-coup-n573371</guid>
      <title>Four Americans Sentenced in Failed Gambian Coup</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:38:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/four-americans-sentenced-failed-gambian-coup-n573371</link>
      <dc:creator>Alex Johnson</dc:creator>
      <description>Defense attorneys argued that had the coup succeeded in ousting dictator Yahya Jammeh, Washington would have hailed the plotters as heroes.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535561/160512-yahya-jammeh-gambia_a8c01dcfb2cc0215cb96046c8dbb7180.jpg" medium="image" height="3744" width="5616">
        <media:credit>AP -- file</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">IMAGE: Gambian President Yahya Jammeh</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Gambian President Yahya Jammeh at an African security summit in Abuja, Nigeria, in February 2014.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535561/160512-yahya-jammeh-gambia_a8c01dcfb2cc0215cb96046c8dbb7180.jpg" medium="image" height="3744" width="5616">
        <media:credit>AP -- file</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">IMAGE: Gambian President Yahya Jammeh</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Gambian President Yahya Jammeh at an African security summit in Abuja, Nigeria, in February 2014.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2015_02/834431/gambia_unrest-jpeg-01c8b_4e4e7d61a416fccbabdaef2e8581c894.jpg" medium="image" height="1500" width="2000">
        <media:credit>Jason Florio</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Post-coup streets in Gambia</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Residents walk on an empty street in Banjul, Gambia, after an attempted coup on Dec. 30, 2014.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535571/070220_gambia_66566a5abcc71b70a29403b98f875488.jpg" medium="image" height="438" width="308">
        <media:credit>AP -- file</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">IMAGE: Gambian President Yahya Jammeh</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Gambian President Yahya Jammeh, right, administers an alleged herbal HIV cure to a patient in Banjul in February 2007 as Secretary of State for Health and Social Welfare Tamsir Mbowe, left, rubs the patient with an ointment.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/joan-rivers-death/civil-case-joan-rivers-death-settled-n573251</guid>
      <title>Civil Case in Joan Rivers' Death Settled </title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:12:53 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/joan-rivers-death/civil-case-joan-rivers-death-settled-n573251</link>
      <dc:creator>Tom Winter</dc:creator>
      <description>A civil case filed on behalf of Melissa Rivers against the doctors and the clinic that operated on the late Joan Rivers has been settled.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2014_36/651906/140905-joan-rivers1-tnc-0942_94955aabdacff57829ed3f815442bce3.jpg" medium="image" height="3000" width="1994">
        <media:credit>Jason Merritt</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: FILE: Comedian Joan Rivers Dies At 81</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Joan Rivers.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2014_50/803486/1d274907409140-today-rivers-141211-1_2a8e9a03a7bdc68bbf3945d0428648c1.jpg" medium="image" height="1407" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Dan Hallman</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Joan and Melissa Rivers</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Comedian Joan Rivers, left, and her daughter Melissa Rivers in 2013.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/watch-georgia-woman-fights-two-carjackers-then-forgives-them-n573351</guid>
      <title>Woman Fights Off Carjackers, Then Forgives Them</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 01:11:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/watch-georgia-woman-fights-two-carjackers-then-forgives-them-n573351</link>
      <dc:creator>Daniella Silva</dc:creator>
      <description>'This young man came up to me with a gun in my face, and in that very instant, I knew I wanted to do something about it,' said Jasmine Warren.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/MSNBC/Components/Video/201605/f_os_carkacking_150612.jpg" medium="image">
        <media:credit></media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain"></media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535531/still0512_00000_1463082374891_2245230_ver1-0_f5b036d46b75347ac64605755b98b912.jpg" medium="image" height="1080" width="1920">
        <media:credit>WXIA-TV</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Jasmine Warren speaks to WXIA</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/after-36-years-prison-tower-power-s-rick-stevens-returns-n573001</guid>
      <title>After 36 Years in Prison, Tower of Power's Rick Stevens Returns to Sing</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:11:12 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/after-36-years-prison-tower-power-s-rick-stevens-returns-n573001</link>
      <dc:creator>Jon Schuppe</dc:creator>
      <description>Four decades after fallen funk singer Rick Stevens killed three men in a botched drug deal, he is going back to prison. This time, it's to entertain.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1534436/160512-rick-stevens-at-bimbos-3_dd35359c0569721accaaabb372617b92.jpg" medium="image" height="284" width="400">
        <media:credit>rickstevensmusic.com</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Rick Stevens performing at Bimbo's.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1534436/160512-rick-stevens-at-bimbos-3_dd35359c0569721accaaabb372617b92.jpg" medium="image" height="284" width="400">
        <media:credit>rickstevensmusic.com</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Rick Stevens performing at Bimbo's.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1534941/160512-rick-stevens-arrest-mdl_bf66b7166a36c11363a1ca9aea9e3863.jpg" medium="image" height="1004" width="1664">
        <media:credit>The Chronicle</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Former Tower of Power lead singer, Rick Stevens, is arrested on Feb. 19, 1976 for multiple murders committed in Boulder Creek and San Jose.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/tens-thousands-gallons-crude-oil-spill-gulf-mexico-n573311</guid>
      <title>Nearly 90,000 Gallons of Crude Oil Spill Into Gulf</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:12:56 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/tens-thousands-gallons-crude-oil-spill-gulf-mexico-n573311</link>
      <dc:creator>Alex Johnson</dc:creator>
      <description>The Coast Guard said the spill had been contained and that two companies were being contracted to begin cleanup operations.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1535446/160512-oil-spill-map_17b9408449ffacbddbbc4098b51f211c.jpg" medium="image" height="575" width="732">
        <media:credit>Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">IMAGE: Map of oil spill site</media:text>

    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2016-election/trump-s-longtime-butler-thinks-president-obama-should-be-hanged-n573331</guid>
      <title>Probe After Trump's Ex-Butler Said Obama Should Be Killed</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:51:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2016-election/trump-s-longtime-butler-thinks-president-obama-should-be-hanged-n573331</link>
      <dc:creator>Alexandra Jaffe and Jane C. Timm </dc:creator>
      <description>Trump's longtime butler told NBC News Thursday that he thinks President Obama should be executed for treason.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1533416/160511-donald-trump-mn-1540_e1bdc5642155b23417cd0e93c62a0616.jpg" medium="image" height="1551" width="2500">
        <media:credit>JIM URQUHART</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Republican U.S. presidential candidate Donald Trump speaks at a campaign rally in Eugene Oregon</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump speaks at a campaign rally in Eugene, Oregon, U.S. on May 6, 2016.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1533416/160511-donald-trump-mn-1540_e1bdc5642155b23417cd0e93c62a0616.jpg" medium="image" height="1551" width="2500">
        <media:credit>JIM URQUHART</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Republican U.S. presidential candidate Donald Trump speaks at a campaign rally in Eugene Oregon</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Donald Trump speaks at a campaign rally in Eugene, Oregon, U.S. on May 6, 2016.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>

    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/business/business-news/me-retire-americans-turn-their-retirement-second-career-n573196</guid>
      <title>Me, Retire? Americans Turn Their Retirement Into a Second Career</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:34:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/business/business-news/me-retire-americans-turn-their-retirement-second-career-n573196</link>
      <dc:creator>Deborah Nason, Special to CNBC.com</dc:creator>
      <description>In fact, a recent AARP study found that 37 percent of working Americans age 50 to 64 plan to work after retiring from their current careers.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2015_12/936591/150318-retirement_1028_f043570c222403b863e9aed95f84e02e.jpg" medium="image" height="664" width="996">
        <media:credit>Ebby May</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Some Americans may be in better shape financially to retire than they think, if they spend less.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/giant-galapagos-tortoise-has-9-hatchlings-aged-80-n572626</guid>

    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/feature/college-game-plan/budding-neuroscientist-chooses-harvard-after-21-college-offers-n572246</guid>
      <title>Budding Neuroscientist Chooses Harvard After 21 College Offers</title>
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 18:05:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/feature/college-game-plan/budding-neuroscientist-chooses-harvard-after-21-college-offers-n572246</link>
      <dc:creator>Susan Donaldson James</dc:creator>
      <description>The 17-year-old, who was born in Guyana, got into 21 colleges, including all eight Ivies. She hopes her story will inspire other minority students.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1533276/kelly_03295460996f1950166c777a10eba293.jpg" medium="image" height="1600" width="900">
        <media:credit>Courtesy of Kelly Hyles</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Kelly Hyles got into 21 colleges, including all eight Ivies.</media:description>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1533276/kelly_03295460996f1950166c777a10eba293.jpg" medium="image" height="1600" width="900">
        <media:credit>Courtesy of Kelly Hyles</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"></media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Kelly Hyles got into 21 colleges, including all eight Ivies.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/queen-s-china-gaffe-beijing-newspaper-calls-british-media-barbarians-n572696</guid>
      <title>Queen's China Gaffe: Beijing Newspaper Calls British Media 'Barbarians'</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:09:23 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/queen-s-china-gaffe-beijing-newspaper-calls-british-media-barbarians-n572696</link>
      <dc:creator>Ed Flanagan</dc:creator>
      <description>The Global Times described the U.K. media as "narcissistic" and "reckless," and accused it of blowing the story out of proportion.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_19/1532536/160511-world-queen-chinese-rude-pink-345a-jpg-0340_bf9a6d20a480438f062f7d2e2eee688f.jpg" medium="image" height="4136" width="3072">
        <media:credit>John Stillwell</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image:</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">Queen Elizabeth II shelters from the rain under an umbrella at a garden party at Buckingham Palace in London, Tuesday.</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcnews.com/tech/apple/fbi-not-likely-tell-apple-about-iphone-vulnerability-n563131</guid>
      <title>FBI Not Likely to Tell Apple About iPhone Vulnerability</title>
      <pubDate>Wed, 27 Apr 2016 01:23:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcnews.com/tech/apple/fbi-not-likely-tell-apple-about-iphone-vulnerability-n563131</link>
      <dc:creator>Pete Williams</dc:creator>
      <description>The FBI has all but concluded that there's nothing to tell Apple about a vulnerability that was exploited to unlock the iPhone used by Syed Farook.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2016_16/1509426/160423-apple-iphone-lock-screen-1205a_084a121661a24a8b7d58ee13e265f68e.jpg" medium="image" height="1695" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Carolyn Kaster</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Apple iPhone</media:text>
        <media:description type="plain">This Feb. 17, 2016 file photo shows an iPhone in Washington. In the searing debate over the FBI's effort to unlock a terrorist's iPhone, federal authorities argue they're seeking only limited help from Apple that won't compromise the privacy of other iPhone users. Security experts say it's not so simple.  (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster)</media:description>
      </media:content>
    </item>
  </channel>
</rss>
